result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Wesley Teasley

records.addlTxt:
3:56 PM  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Charles Wesley Teasley.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Charles Wesley Teasley appeared by video, in custody from Adams County Jail. 

Court calls case.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

Matter is set for a waived preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Atty Bergner does not have a prelim waiver form but has gone over the form with his client.
Defendant concurs.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Charles Wesley Teasley appeared by video, in custody in Wood County.  Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of Atty Maxwell Bergner for Charles Wesley Teasley.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 09/26/22 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: J.S.  (no condition on bond for victim to be able to file Family Safety Plan)

1:48 PM Defendant Charles Wesley Teasley appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Battery and Strangulation. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is  eligible for public defender representation.
Defendant states he is homeless.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
